result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael P. Coupe Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Sentence withheld, 3 years probation, consecutive to 12CM337 and concurrent with 13CF85.  Conditions of probation: 90 days jail with Huber for work search or to attend WITC, driver must provide proof of license and insurance. AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.   Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Restitution in the amount of $ 10,957.30 payable to Hayward Memorial Area Hospital, 11040N State Rd 77, Hayward, WI 54843.   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge. Costs of $518.00, including DNA surcharge.

Consecutive to:  consecutive to 12CM337 and concurrent with 13CF85.

miscConds.notes: Restitution $10,957.30   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Costs $268.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.dispoDesc:
Probation revoked.  Sentenced 8-14-19.
1.5 years initital confinement, 1.5 years extended supervision- consecutive to the federal conviction and consecutive to 13CF85.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Defendant is subject to No contact with Victim condition as applied by DOC.  Absolute Sobriety, with random testing.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  All unpaid previously ordered financial obligations are converted to Clerk of Court collect and judgment is entered.  
DE has credit for 382 days in 14CF71.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael P. Coupe Jr.
Current: 13034 W Watertower Ln, Hayward, WI 54843 United States  (Effective: 06-03-2020)
Prior: 1300 Lange Court, c/o Sauk County Jail, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States

10:48 AM Defendant Michael P. Coupe in court, appearing by telephone from custody in Sauk County Jail (being housed there for prison sentence.)  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DE has filed motions in two cases 13CF85 and 14CF71.  Court has reviewed submissions.
Mr. Coupe makes statement.  DA makes statement, objects to the credit the DE is asking for, as he feels they need more information from the DOC in regards to computing any additional credit.
Mr Coupe makes further comment regarding federal sentence, state sentences, and credit given.
Court: Sentence credit:  State sentences were consecutive, has not seen paperwork that shows credit was not given to the DE.  Consecutive sentence was the intent of the court, it was two separate matters- State sentences were to be consecutive.  
Court:  If DE can supply the court with documenation that shows credit was not given to the DE the Court can reconsider.
Motions denied.
Motion hearing on December 11, 2019 at 10:45 am.

From Dodge Correctional Institution
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief.

08:47 AM  Defendant Michael P. Coupe in court with attorney Ronald K Colwell.  Defendant Michael P. Coupe in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation has been revoked.  There is not a joint agreement.  Atty Poquette makes statement, references PSI, argues for maximum penalty.  The State references victim's impact statement.  Asks for consecutive sentence to other revocation case and federal case.  Cites 2 new pending matters 18CF179 and 17CF368.
8:56 am Atty Colwell makes statement. Asks for concurrent sentence.   Absolute Sobriety and random testing.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  
9:09 am Court statement.  

Sentence:  13CF85:  1.5 years initial confinement, 1.5 years extended supervision, consecutive to the federal conviction.  Conditions of extended supervision: Absolute Sobriety, with random testing. Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   All unpaid previously ordered financial obligations are converted to Clerk of Court collect and judgment is entered.
Sentence: 14CF71   1.5 years initital confinement, 1.5 years extended supervision- consecutive to the federal conviction and consecutive to 13CF85.
Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Defendant is subject to No contact with Victim condition as applied by DOC.  Absolute Sobriety, with random testing.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  All unpaid previously ordered financial obligations are converted to Clerk of Court collect and judgment is entered.  DE has credit for 382 days in 14CF71.
